law.text: After the creation of a construction district under the provisions of KRS 220.553 to 220.561, the board may, if the board deems it feasible, instead of issuing bonds as provided in KRS 220.575, issue apportionment warrants, using the procedures after assessment set out in KRS 184.150 to 184.250, "road district" being read as "sanitation district," "board of directors" being read as "sanitation district board" and the reference to roads being read as reference to sewers and treatment plants.
law.history: Amended 1978 Ky. Acts ch. 384, sec. 80, effective June 17, 1978. -- Created 1966 Ky. Acts ch. 92, sec. 17.
